entries.title: UK Strikes and Crumbling Health Service Add Headaches for Sunak
entries.description: British rail workers will walk off the job much of this week, paralyzing transport and adding to the troubles piling up for Prime Minister Rishi Sunak’s government.

entries.title: Yemen Plans $130 Million Port, Road in Mahra to Move Minerals
entries.description: Yemen plans to start building a port in the Qishn area of the eastern Mahra region at a cost of $130 million in two months, Deputy Transport Minister Naser Shuraif said.

entries.title: Biden Says No Nuclear Drills With Seoul After Yoon’s Comments
entries.description: President Joe Biden said he isn’t currently discussing joint nuclear exercises with South Korea after that country’s president said his government wanted a more active role in managing atomic weapons on the Korean Peninsula.

entries.title: China’s Economy Ends Year in Slump as Covid Infections Surge
entries.description: China’s economy ended the year in a major slump as business and consumer spending plunged in December, with more disruption likely in the first few months of the year as Covid infections surge across the country.

entries.title: McCarthy Faces Speaker-Vote Showdown as GOP Takes Over House
entries.description: Representative Kevin McCarthy’s chances of becoming House speaker remained in doubt 24 hours before Republicans formally take control of the chamber.

entries.title: Mexico Prison Break Near US Border Leaves 17 Dead, Gang Leader on Run
entries.description: A prison break in Mexico’s Ciudad Juarez left 17 people dead and allowed 25 inmates to escape in a revival of the penitentiary-system violence that paralyzed the US bordering city last year.

entries.title: Man Arrested on Attempted Murder Charges in NYC Machete Attack
entries.description: New York (AP) -- A man accused of attacking police with a machete near New York’s Times Square on New Year’s Eve, injuring two officers, was arrested Monday on attempted murder charges, police said Monday.

entries.title: Graft Scandal Escalates With Bid to Lift EU Lawmakers’ Immunity
entries.description: The president of the European Parliament said she’s started an “urgent procedure” to waive the immunity of two more socialist lawmakers suspected of involvement in a sprawling corruption scandal involving Qatar.

entries.title: Brazil Markets Sink as Traders Mull Lula’s Plan to Beef Up State
entries.description: Brazilian assets tumbled on the first session of 2023 as traders digested plans by President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva to use state-owned companies to drive economic growth.

entries.title: Argentina’s President Seeks to Impeach Supreme Court Chief
entries.description: President Alberto Fernandez is seeking to impeach the leader of Argentina’s Supreme Court, a maneuver that escalates his recent feud with the court but that’s unlikely to succeed in congress.

entries.title: Prince Harry Says He Wants His Father and Brother Back
entries.description: The Duke of Sussex has said he wants his father and brother back during an ITV interview due to be released this Sunday, two days before his memoir is published.

entries.title: Brazil Analysts See Higher Rates, Prices Rising Faster With Lula
Germany Vows Crackdown After Brutal New Year’s Violence
entries.description: Germany vowed to crack down on people responsible for violence around the weekend’s New Year celebrations, in which dozens of police, paramedics and firefighters were injured.

entries.title: Harry to Share Details About New Book in 'Revealing' Interview on US TV Show
entries.description: The Duke of Sussex has shared details about his new book on a US TV show in a "revealing" interview set to be aired on Sunday.

entries.title: Ukraine Latest: Drones Shot Down as Russia Launches Barrage
entries.description: Ukraine downed all 39 Iran-made Shahed drones launched overnight, as well as two Russian-made Orlan drones and a cruise missile, the country’s air defense command said on Telegram.

entries.title: Modi’s Cash Ban Was Legal, India Court Rules Amid Faint Dissent
entries.description: India’s Supreme Court upheld Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s 2016 decision to overnight invalidate high-value currency notes, a decision that could provide firepower to the ruling party ahead of a series of elections in coming months.

entries.title: Helicopter Collision Near Australia Theme Park Leaves 4 Dead
entries.description: Four people have died and three are critically injured after a mid-air collision involving two helicopters near the Sea World theme park on Australia’s Gold Coast.

entries.title: South Korea Asks US for Greater Role in Managing Nuclear Weapons
entries.description: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol said his government is in talks with the US on taking a more active role in managing nuclear weapons on the Korean Peninsula, which would mark a significant shift in a decades-old policy among American allies to deter North Korea.

entries.title: Israeli Missile Strikes Put Damascus Airport Out of Service
entries.description: Beirut (AP) -- Israel’s military fired missiles toward the international airport of Syria's capital early Monday, putting it out of service and killing two soldiers and wounding two others, the Syrian army said.

entries.title: Hearings on Google Fine and Gay Marriage Reach India’s Courts
entries.description: India’s courts will begin the new year with a clutch of hearings including a fight to recognize same-sex marriage, a plea against the anti-trust agency’s fine on Google, and petitions challenging the legality of Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s 2016 move to ban high-value currency notes.

entries.title: UK Patients 'Resorting to DIY Medicine' Due to Lack of Doctor Appointments
entries.description: Some sick people are resorting to do-it-yourself medical treatment because they cannot get a face-to-face appointment with a family doctor, according to new research.
